value.highlighted:
1class CartPoleEnv : public BaseEnv
2{
3private:
4 ...
5 double gravity = 9.81;
6 double masscart = 1.0;
7 double masspole = 0.1;
8 double total_mass = masspole + masscart;
9 double length = 0.5; // half the pole's length
10 double polemass_length = masspole * length;
11 double force_mag = 10.0;
12 double tau = 0.02; // seconds between state updates
13 std::string kinematic_integrator = "euler";
14 
15 double theta_threshold_radians = 12 * 2 * 3.1415926 / 360; // angle at which to fail the episode
16 double x_threshold = 2.4; // distance at which to fail the episode
17 
18 double x = 0;
19 double theta = 0;
20 double x_dot = 0;
21 double theta_dot = 0;
22 
23 int time_step = 0;
24 int max_steps = 200;
25 bool steps_beyond_done = false;
26 
27 
28public:
29 CartPoleEnv() {}
30 
31 ~CartPoleEnv() {}
32 
33 py::object reset() override
34 {
35 py::dict result;
36 std::random_device rd;
37 std::mt19937 gen(rd());
38 std::uniform_real_distribution<> dis(-0.05, 0.05);
39 
40 x = dis(gen);
41 x_dot = dis(gen);
42 theta = dis(gen);
43 theta_dot = dis(gen);
44 time_step = 0;
45 steps_beyond_done = false;
46 
47 result["observation"] = py::make_tuple(x, x_dot, theta, theta_dot);
48 result["info"] = "";
49 return result;
50 }
51 
52 py::object step(const py::object& input_dict) override
53 {
54 py::dict result;
55 if (!input_dict.contains("action"))
56 {
57 result["info"] = "input_dict does not contain 'action'";
58 return result;
59 }
60 
61 int action;
62 try
63 {
64 action = input_dict["action"].cast<int>();
65 }
66 catch (const std::exception &e)
67 {
68 result["info"] = std::string("failed to convert action to int: ") + e.what();
69 return result;
70 }
71 
72 if (action != 0 && action != 1)
73 {
74 result["info"] = "action must be either 0 or 1";
75 return result;
76 }
77 
78 double force = action * force_mag;
79 double costheta = cos(theta);
80 double sintheta = sin(theta);
81 
82 // For the interested reader:
83 // https://coneural.org/florian/papers/05_cart_pole.pdf
84 double temp = (force + polemass_length * theta_dot * theta_dot * sintheta) / total_mass;
85 double theta_acc = (gravity * sintheta - costheta * temp) / (length * (4.0 / 3.0 - masspole * costheta * costheta / total_mass));
86 double x_acc = temp - polemass_length * theta_acc * costheta / total_mass;
87 
88 if (kinematic_integrator == "euler")
89 {
90 x = x + tau * x_dot;
91 x_dot = x_dot + tau * x_acc;
92 theta = theta + tau * theta_dot;
93 theta_dot = theta_dot + tau * theta_acc;
94 }
95 else if (kinematic_integrator == "semi-implicit-euler")
96 {
97 x_dot = x_dot + tau * x_acc;
98 x = x + tau * x_dot;
99 theta_dot = theta_dot + tau * theta_acc;
100 theta = theta + tau * theta_dot;
101 }
102 else
103 {
104 result["info"] = "unknown kinematic integrator";
105 return result;
106 }
107 
108 time_step ++;
109 bool terminated = ((x < -x_threshold) || (x > x_threshold) || (theta < -theta_threshold_radians) || (theta > theta_threshold_radians));
110 bool truncated = (time_step >= max_steps);
111 
112 double reward;
113 if (!terminated && !truncated)
114 {
115 reward = 1.0;
116 }
117 else if (!steps_beyond_done)
118 {
119 if (terminated)
120 {
121 reward = 0.0;
122 }
123 else if (truncated)
124 {
125 reward = 1.0;
126 }
127 steps_beyond_done = true;
128 }
129 else
130 {
131 reward = 0.0;
132 result["info"] = "You are calling 'step()' even though this environment has already returned terminated = True. "
133 "You should always call 'reset()' once you receive 'terminated = True' -- any further steps are undefined behavior.";
134 }
135 
136 result["observation"] = py::make_tuple(x, x_dot, theta, theta_dot);
137 result["reward"] = reward;
138 result["terminated"] = terminated;
139 result["truncated"] = truncated;
140 
141 if (!result.contains("info"))
142 {
143 result["info"] = "";
144 }
145 
146 return result;
147 }
148};
